title: The One With Ross' New Girlfriend

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is recapping last season, and as she talks we see a
montague of scenes from Ross and Rachel.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, so this is pretty much what's happened so far. Ross was in love with Rachel since, you know, forever, but every time he tried to tell her, something kind of got in the way, like cats, and Italian guys. Finally Chandler was like "forget about her" but when Ross was in China on his dig, Chandler let it slip that Ross was in love with Rachel. She was like, "Oh my god." So she went to the airport to meet him when he came back, but what she didn't know was, that Ross was getting off the plane with another woman. Uh-Oh! So, that's pretty much everything you need to know. But, enough about us. So, how've you been?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my god. Oh my god. (She decides to make a break for it.) Excuse me. Move! Move! Emergency! Excuse me! (She tries climbing over a bench and falls down.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (seeing her) Rach!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, there you are! Hi! Oh, so, so, how was China, you? (Hits him with the flowers.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It was, it was great. Oh, what happened?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're bleeding.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I am? Oh, look at that, yes I am. Enough about me, enough about me, Mr. Back from the Orient. Come on. I wanna hear everything! Everything. (Looks at Julie)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, where do I start? This is Julie. Julie, this is Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: These are, these aren't for you. (to Julie) These are for you. (Loudly, thinking she can't speak English.) Welcome to our country.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: (Loudly, proving she can speak English.) Thank you. I'm from New York.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, well, not a problem. We'll just use them to stop the bleeding. Ok. Baggage claim? Ok.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is waiting for Rachel to return from the airport
with Ross.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No way!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm telling you, she went to the airport, and she's gonna go for it with Ross!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my god. This is huge. This is bigger than huge. This is like, all right, what's bigger than huge?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Um, this?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Guys, you got your hair cut.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, we did, thanks to Vidal Buffay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: 'Cause, you know, (in that voice) if you don't look good, we don't look good. I love that voice.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering, out of breath) Airport, airport. Ross, not alone, Julie, arm around her. Cramp, cramp.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, I think she's trying to tell us something. Quick, get the verbs.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) You, you, you said he liked me. (Ross and Julie enter) You, you slowpokes!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That's all right, Rach, we got the bags. Hi, hello. Julie, this is my sister Monica. This is Chandler. Phoebe. Joey, what up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What up?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Everyone, this is Julie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (out of breath) Julie.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ohh. (Happily) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Hi, but I'm not here, you haven't met me. I'll make a much better first impression tomorrow when I don't have 20 hours of cab and plane on me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And bus.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: The screaming guy?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: And the spitting?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You gotta hear this story.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: We're on this bus, that's easily 200 years old...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: 200 at least.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: ...and this guy...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: And the chicken pooped in her lap. Oh, I'm so sorry. I just gave away the ending, didn't I? Oh! It's just, I just heard this story in the cab, and it is all I can think about.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This is amazing. I mean, how, how did this happen?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Well, Ross and I were in grad school together.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But we haven't seen each other since then. Well I land in China, guess who's in charge of the dig.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Julie! Julie, isn't that great? I mean, isn't that just kick-you-in-the-crotch, spit-on-your-neck fantastic?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Julie) It's an expression.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, we just wanted to say a quick hi, and then we're gonna go see the baby.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: And then we've gotta get some sleep.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's really 6:00 tomorrow night our time.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, listen, don't tell us what's gonna happen though, 'cause I like to be surprised.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye. (She closes the door and everyone tries to sympathize with her.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler enter.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach, can I get some coffee?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach, can I get...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did you talk to him?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Not yet.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then, no.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So what the hell happened to you in China? I mean, when last we left you, you were totally in love with, you know.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I know, I know I was, but there was always this little voice inside that kept saying it's never gonna happen, move on. You know whose voice that was?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: God?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It was you, pal.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it was God, doing me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, you were right. She looks at me and sees a friend, that's all. But then I met Julie, and I don't know, we're havin' a great time. And I have to say, I never would've gone for it with her if it hadn't been for you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, you owe me one, big guy.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (To Ross) Here's your lemonade.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I didn't order lemonade.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh. Well then, you better go take that back because they're gonna charge you for that.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Go-go-go-go, come on! (Ross goes over to the counte) (to Chandler) So uh, what did you find out?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He said...he said, he said that they're having a great time. I'm sorry. But, the silver lining, if you wanna see it, is that he made the decision all by himself! Without any outside help whatsoever.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How is that the silver lining?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You have to really wanna see it.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and the gang is watching Sumo wrestling on TV.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ironically, these are the guys who were picked last in gym.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pheebes, you know what I'm thinking?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, ok. How, it's been so long since you've had sex, you're wondering if they've changed it?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, although now that's what I'm thinking.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, so what were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, I was thinking, that you gave the guys such great haircuts, I thought, maybe you'd like to do mine?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohh! No.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Because, I'm just, I'm incredibly anal and an unbelievable control freak.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No you're not.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know I'm not, but you are, and I was trying to spare your feelings.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (answering the phone) Hello? Oh, hi. Yeah, hold on a second. Ross, it's Julie, for you. (Throws him the phone.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Hello? Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi. Anybody know a good tailor?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Needs some clothes altered?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no, I'm just looking for a man to draw on me with chalk.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why don't you go see Frankie? My family's been goin' to him forever. He did my first suit when I was 15. No wait, 16. No, 'scuse me, 15. (still confused) All right, when was 1990?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. You have to stop the Q-tip when there's resistance!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (on phone) Ok, ok, sweetheart, I'll see you later. Ok, bye. What? (Sits down next to Rachel) Oh, that is so sweet. No, no, ok, you hang up. Ok, ok, one, two, three. (Doesn't hang up and motions for Rachel to be quiet) Well you didn't hang up either.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: She didn't hang up either!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok, no, no, you hang up. You, you, y...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (taking the phone and hanging it up) Sorry, I thought you were talking to me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Rachel! I'll just call her back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (calls Julie back) Hi? Sorry, we got disconnected... (Walks away.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Ok, ok, ok. How did this happen to me? How did this happen to me? A week ago, two weeks ago, I was fine. Ross was just Ross, just this guy. Now he's Rrrooossss, oh, this really great guy that I can't have.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sweetie, I wanted you to have him too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know you did. I'm just gonna deal with it, I'm just gonna deal with it. (Ross comes by, smoching with Julie on the phone.) I gotta get out of here. (Exits)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ok, I don't care what you guys say, something's bothering her.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) You know, I think I was sixteen.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Please, just a little bit off the back.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm still on "no."

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (poking her head in from her bedroom) Uh, morning. Do you guys think you could close your eyes for just a sec?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No-no-no-no-no, (grabs his pants) I'm not fallin' for that again.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I sorta did a stupid thing last night.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What stupid thing did you do?

dialogue.speaker: PAULO
dialogue.text: (entering from Rachel's room) Bon giorno tutti!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ewww! (Gets up and walks away.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, Paulo, why don't you just go get dressed, and then you be on your way, ok, bye-bye. (Paulo goes into his room.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rachel, how did this happen?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know, I just kinda ran into him last night.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Where?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: At his apartment. Is this juice?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa. And the fact that you dumped him because he hit on Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh God, I know I'm a pathetic loser.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Honey, you're not pathetic, you're sad.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: People do stupid things when they're upset.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: My god, if I had a nickel for every guy I wish I hadn't...(Everyone looks at her), but this is about your horrible mistake.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi. Sorry we're late but we were—well, there was touching.

dialogue.speaker: PAULO
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, hey Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, Paulo. What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: PAULO
dialogue.text: I do Raquel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) So, uh, he's back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, he's back. Is that a problem?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, not a problem.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good! I'm glad it's not a problem.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Paulo) Ok, you're gonna have to not touch my ass.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, in spite of the yummy bagels and palpable tension, I've got pants that need to be altered.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Chandler, when you see Frankie, tell him Joey Tribbiani says hello. He'll know what it means.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Are you sure he's gonna be able to crack that code?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) You know it's funny, the last time Paulo was here, my hair was so much shorter and cuter.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. Ok, but, but! You have to promise that you will not be all like control-y and bossy and Monica about it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I promise.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. (Talking to Monica's hair.) Now some of you are gonna get cut, and some of you aren't. But I promise none of you are gonna feel a thing.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's bedroom, Phoebe is finishing with her haircut and Monica is whincing.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, that's it, I quit.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What? I didn't say anything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but this (makes Monica's face) isn't the face of a person who trusts a person. Ok, this (makes Monica's face) is the face of a person who, you know, doesn't trust a person.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Phoebe. It's just a little shorter than what we had discussed.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Would you relax? I know what I am doing. This is how he wears it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How who wears it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Demi Moore.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Demi Moore is not a he.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, he was a he in Arthur , and in Ten .

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That's Dudley Moore. I said I wanted it like Demi Moore.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh. Oh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God! I'm sorry, I'm sorry. Which one's Demi Moore?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: She's the act ress that was in Disclosure , Indecent Proposal , Ghost !

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, she's got gorgeous hair.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know !

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Frank's tailor shop, Chandler is getting his pants measured.]

dialogue.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogue.text: How long do you want the cuffs?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: At least as long as I have the pants.

dialogue.speaker: FRANKIE
dialogue.text: I just got that. Ok, now we'll do your inseam.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is recovering from her haircut, Phoebe is playing
her doctor and is coming in from the bedroom.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: How is she?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It's too soon to tell. She's resting, which is a good sign.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How's the hair?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm not gonna lie to you, Ross, it doesn't look good. I put a clip on one side, which seems to have stopped the curling.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Can we see her?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Your hair looks too good, I think it would upset her. Ross, why don't you come on in.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah. (Gets up, but then pauses when he realizes what that meant.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How're you doing?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ooh, that bad, huh?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, I can sense when women are depressed and vulnerable. It's one of my gifts.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: When I saw him get off that plane with her, I really thought I hit rock bottom. But today, it's like there's rock bottom, 50 feet of crap, then me.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You gotta tell Ross how you feel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on. How can I just tell him? What about Julie?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What about her? They've only been going out for two weeks. Ross has been in love with you for like 10 years.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don't know, I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, Rach, Rach! I've been with my share of women. In fact, I've been with like a lot of people's share of women. The point is, I've never felt about anyone the way Ross felt about you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering, angry) Yo, paisan! Can I talk to you for a sec? (Pause) Your tailor is a very bad man!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Frankie? What're you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering from the bedroom) Hey, what's goin' on? (Pats Chandler on the shoulder which causes him to jump.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Joey's tailor...took advantage of me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No way. I've been going to the guy for 12 years.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh come on! He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand up my leg, and then, there was definite...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Cupping.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That's how they do pants! First they go up one side, they move it over, then they go up the other side, they move it back, and then they do the rear. (Chandler and Ross stare at him) What? Ross, Ross, would you tell him? Isn't that how they measure pants?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yes, yes it is. In prison! Whatsa matter with you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What? That's not? (Realizes) Oh my God.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, later that day.  Monica is now out and about.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Even Mary Tyler Moore would've been better.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I like it. I do, I think it's a Ten. (Chandler laughs.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you. My hair is very amused.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Come on, Monica, things could be worse. You could get caught between the moon and New York City. I know it's crazy, but it's true.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Chandler and Ross) Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, I gotta go. Bye. Bye, Rach.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sticking her head in from the balcony) Wait, are you leaving?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, that's kinda what I meant by "bye!"

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, can I talk to you for a sec?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. (goes out onto the balcony)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, when the doctor does that hernia test...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's ok.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's goin' on?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, first of all, Paulo and I are not back together. It was just a stupid thing I did, and if I could go back in time and do it again, well, I wouldn't. Um, second of all (Ross is laughing), what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok. Well, before I say anything, I just need to know, is this one of those things where you break up with a guy, and then I tell you what I think, and then the next day you get back together with the guy, and I look like a complete idiot?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. No-no-no-no.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, then, I think, I think the guy is scum. I hate him. I mean I actually—I-I physically hate him. I always have. You are way too good to be with a guy like that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You deserve to be with someone who appreciates you, and who gets how funny and sweet and amazing, and adorable, and sexy you are, you know? Someone who wakes up every morning thinking "Oh my god, I'm with Rachel". You know, someone who makes you feel good, the way I am with Julie. (Rachel has moved closer, but hearing that she starts to back up.) Was there a second of all?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, I think that was the whole all.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay. Okay. (They hug.) Okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I swear to god, Dad. That's not how they measure pants.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Julie is wanting to get her hair cut from Phoebe.]

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: I was thinking of doing it a little shorter, you know, like Andie McDowell's new haircut?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! Oh, I can do that.

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You wanna do it right now?

dialogue.speaker: JULIE
dialogue.text: Great! (Julie leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) Ok, I just wanna be really sure this time. Andie McDowell's the girl from Four Weddings and a Funeral , right?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. No no no no no. That's Rodney McDowell. Andie McDowell is the guy from Planet of the Apes .

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. Ok, thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You're welcome.
